perturbation.original_text: In this Agreement: (a) "Agent" and "Agents" have the respective meanings given to them above; (b) "Agents' Counsel" means Dentons Canada LLP; (c) "Agents' Fee" has the meaning given in Section 1(1)(a); (d) "Agreement" means the agreement resulting from the acceptance by the Corporation of the offer made by the Agents by this letter; (e) "Applicable Securities Laws" means all applicable securities laws, rules, regulations, notices and published policies of the Selling Jurisdictions in Canada and the United States; (f) "Business Day" means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or statutory or civic holiday in Toronto, Ontario; (g) "Closing" means the completion of the Offering; (h) "Closing Date" means May 21, 2015 or such other date as the Corporation and the Agents may agree upon in writing, or as may be changed pursuant to this Agreement; (i) "Closing Time" means 8:00 a.m. (Toronto time) on the Closing Date; (j) "Corporation" has the meaning given to it above; (k) "Corporation's Auditors" means such firm of chartered accountants as the Corporation may have appointed or may from time to time appoint as auditors of the Corporation, including prior auditors of the Corporation, as applicable; (l) "Corporation's Counsel" means Fogler Rubinoff LLP; (m) "Compensation Options" has the meaning ascribed thereto on the face page of this Agreement; (n) "Compensation Option Certificates" shall mean the certificates representing the Compensation Options; (o) "Debt Instrument" means any loan, bond, debenture, promissory note or other instrument evidencing indebtedness (demand or otherwise) for borrowed money or other liability;
perturbation.changed_text: In this Agreement: (a) "Agent" and "Agents" have the respective meanings given to them above; (b) "Agents' Counsel" means Dentons Canada LLP; (c) "Agents' Fee" has the meaning given in Section 1(1)(a); (d) "Agreement" means the agreement resulting from the acceptance by the Corporation of the offer made by the Agents by this letter; (e) "Applicable Securities Laws" means only the securities laws, rules, regulations, notices and published policies of the Selling Jurisdictions in Canada; (f) "Business Day" means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or statutory or civic holiday in Toronto, Ontario; (g) "Closing" means the commencement, but not necessarily the completion, of the Offering; (h) "Closing Date" means May 21, 2015 or such other date as the Corporation and the Agents may agree upon in writing, or as may be changed pursuant to this Agreement; (i) "Closing Time" means 8:00 a.m. (Toronto time) on the Closing Date; (j) "Corporation" has the meaning given to it above; (k) "Corporation's Auditors" means such firm of chartered accountants as the Corporation may have appointed or may from time to time appoint as auditors of the Corporation, excluding prior auditors of the Corporation, as applicable; (l) "Corporation's Counsel" means Fogler Rubinoff LLP; (m) "Compensation Options" has the meaning ascribed thereto on the face page of this Agreement; (n) "Compensation Option Certificates" shall mean the certificates representing the Compensation Options; (o) "Debt Instrument" means any loan, bond or debenture;
perturbation.explanation:
The modified text introduces contradictions by:
1.  Limiting "Applicable Securities Laws" to only Canadian jurisdictions, conflicting with later sections that reference US securities laws.
2.  Redefining "Closing" to mean commencement rather than completion of the offering which affects the interpretation of when obligations are fulfilled.
3.  Excluding prior auditors from "Corporation's Auditors", which may have ramifications if the company refers to 'Corporation's Auditors' in the future and create ambiguity. 
4. Narrowing Debt Instrument definition.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration for the Agents' services hereunder, the Corporation will pay to the Agents the Agents' Fee and the Corporation shall issue to the Agents that number of Compensation Options equal to 3.5% of the number of Offered Shares sold pursuant to the Offering. Unless otherwise stated herein, the Offered Shares shall also refer to the Compensation Options. The Agents' Fee shall be apportioned among the Agents as follows: Dundee Securities Ltd. 40% Kes 7 Capital Inc. 30% Bloom Burton & Co. Ltd. 30% 100%
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for the Agents' services hereunder, the Corporation may pay to the Agents the Agents' Fee, contingent on the Corporation's sole discretion, and the Corporation shall issue to the Agents that number of Compensation Options equal to 1% of the number of Offered Shares sold pursuant to the Offering. Unless otherwise stated herein, the Offered Shares shall only refer to common shares, and specifically exclude the Compensation Options. The Agents' Fee shall be apportioned among the Agents equally.
perturbation.explanation:
The modified text contradicts the original agreement by:

1.  Making the Agent's Fee payment discretionary rather than obligatory.
2.  Changing the percentage of Compensation Options issued.
3.  Altering what "Offered Shares" refers to, excluding Compensation Options.
4.  Changing the fee apportionment to equal parts instead of percentages. This creates ambiguity in the contract's commitment and Agent compensation.

perturbation.original_text: The Corporation shall have obtained the conditional approval of the TSX-V and any other applicable exchange in respect of the issuance and sale of the Offered Shares and all other necessary regulatory approvals prior to the Closing.
perturbation.changed_text: The Corporation shall attempt to obtain the conditional approval of the TSX-V and any other applicable exchange in respect of the issuance and sale of the Offered Shares and attempt to obtain all other necessary regulatory approvals prior to the Closing.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text transforms a strict requirement into an attempt to get the approval. 'Shall' indicates a firm obligation, whereas 'attempt' creates a non-binding situation that could be difficult to enforce. Creates uncertainty as to the regulatory pre-conditions for closing.
